text: Le repas était excellent malgré le fait que j'ai pris la seule chose qui n'était pas coréen ou japonnais. Pour les amateurs de poulet général tao, celui du Petit tokebi est un incontournable lors du lunch. Un mélange de légume de riz et de poulet croustillant servi sur un plateau avec différents accompagnements : (salade, dumpling, soupe miso). Étant un bon mangeur, je peux dire que ma faim était comblée après ce repas. Ma copine à opter pour le classique, le fameux bibimbap au poulet. L'odeur qui s'y dégageait était décadente. Servi dans un plat chaud(un dolsot), ce mélange de saveures coréenes était à tomber. Puisque ma copine n'a pas tout manger, nous avons pris le reste pour emporter (youpi un lunch de fait) C'est un repas à essayer absolument! Vous en redemandez encor!  Le service était bien aussi; repas servi en un temps raisonnable, serveur poli, tables propres, terrasse acceuillant. Je n'ai rien de négatif à dire. Pour un lunch à 12$ le repas je suis très heureux d'avoir trouver cet endroit. j'ai eu une belle expérience culinaire à ce restaurant!
J'adore, jy suis allee 2 fois en une semaine avec mes filles et mon mAri. Je recommande fortement

We just came home from here on a date night.    What a lovely little place.    We were here about 6 years ago when it was called 5000 Years but it's changed a lot. We walked in and were sat in a cozy little area all to ourselves.    Quickly ordered a couple of cold Saporos.     Our shared appetizer was the vegetarian deep fried dumpling.....6 of them for $7.99.    Totally worth it. I ordered the seafood Yaki Udon hot bowl ($16.99), he ordered the Fish Katsu bento box ($16.99).  About mine.....the udon noodles were PERFECT.....fat, meaty and wonderful.    The seafood is unfortunately all frozen - salad shrimp is not a good choice for this bowl.    The rest of the seafood (except for the clams) was very rubbery.     All that said......the taste of the dish was really, really good.    So, frozen food aside, I'd actually order it again. About his......his fish was also frozen but you couldn't tell so easily as it is breaded and deep fried.   The bento box is nothing to rave about but everything in it was well seasoned, nicely presented and tasty.    It just seemed mostly empty, which is a shame.    Would he order it again?    Probably  :-) Miso soup is better than average.  The place is a teensy hidden little charming underground  secret that you've probably walked by 100 times if you live in the area (we do, we walked around the corner to get there). It's absolutely worth a shot.     There are obvious misses but it will still be a pleasant way to spend an evening, so do try it out.    The service is warm and very professional, the little rooms are delightful.    You should go!

Went there for dinner.  Standard Japanese (bentos, udon) and Korean (bibimbap) cuisine. The prices were fair, and the portions were good. Nothing too outstanding. The decor was nice.   Downside, the only bathroom on facility is pretty miserable. There is no tea served accompanying the meal.  I would recommend the bibimpab, served in a hot stone bowl. Skip the bento, the pork tonkatsu is nothing to write home about.  Overall, a great lunch option if in the area with solid portions and fair prices.
Assez bon , belle petite terrasse, bonnes portions, mon assiette trop chaude parcontre ... J'ai pas pu manger qu'apres plus que 5 min lol.  Seems clean :)
